text:
e="preserve">Sheldon Anthony Gomes (18 October 1950 – 15 September 2020) was a cricketer. He played first-class and List A cricket for Trinidad and Tobago and other Trinidad teams from 1969 to 1983. That was also his most prolific first-class season, with 633 runs at an average of 70.33 and three centuries.
Gomes died in Las Vegas, Nevada, on 15 September 2020 at the age of 69.
